citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Male Bulldog (microchip 7E10334920, tattoo #5) has an abnormal condition of the eyes. The center of the cornea of both
eyes is cloudy and the white of the right eye is moderately reddened and the white of the left eye is slightly reddened. A
thick greenish mucousy discharge is located along the bottom eyelid of both eyes and attached to the hair along the
eyelids. The dog had received treatment for the eyes between April 19th-24th, but is currently receiving no treatment.
Male bulldog (microchip 7E10334877, tattoo #7) has an abnormal condition of the eyes. The white of the right eye is
moderately reddened and the white of the left eye is slightly reddened. A thick greenish mucousy discharge is located
across the surface of the right eye and along the bottom eyelid of both eyes. The dog had received treatment for the eyes
between April 19th-24th, but is currently receiving no treatment.
Female bulldog (microchip 4982829, tattoo #2) has an abnormal condition of the eyes. The center of the cornea of both
eyes is cloudy and the white of the right eye is moderately reddened and the white of the left eye is slightly reddened. A
thick greenish mucousy discharge is located along the bottom eyelid of both eyes and dried discharge is attached to the
hair surrounding the eyes. The condition of the dog's eyes has not been noticed and no treatment is currently being
provided.
Female bulldog (microchip 7E10334736, tattoo #138) has an abnormal condition of the foot. A round dark colored growth
is located between the toes on the right front foot. The condition of the dog's foot has not been noticed and no treatment
is currently being provided.
Abnormal conditions of the eyes and feet could cause pain and discomfort to the animals.
Dealers must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The licensee must
have these dogs evaluated by a veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an appropriate treatment plan. The
licensee must ensure each dog receives adequate veterinary care at all times.

The dogs are housed on raised flooring. The inspectors observed the feet of the following dogs pass through the
openings in the flooring:
Maltese #3
Poodle #20
Maltese #18
Maltese #8
Poodle #22
Maltese #19
Bernadoodle #47
Maltese #20
Maltese #21
Maltese #4
Maltese #6
Yorkshire terrier #8
Yorkshire terrier #9
The inspector measured the width of a front foot of two of the dogs and found the foot to be 3/4 of an inch wide for one
dog and one inch wide for the other dog. The openings in the flooring measured over an inch wide. Openings in flooring
large enough to allow a dog's foot to pass through could cause injury to the animal and affect its ability to move around in
a normal manner.
Primary enclosures must have floors that are constructed in a manner that protects the dogs' feet and legs from injury,
and that, if of mesh or slatted construction, do not allow the dogs' feet to pass through any openings in the floor. The
licensee must alter the floor in a manner that protects the animals from injury and eliminates the ability of their feet to pass
through any openings. The licensee must ensure the enclosure flooring is safe for the dogs at all times.
To be corrected by: 16-May-2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
William Janecke, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Male Bulldog (microchip 7E10334920, tattoo #5) has an abnormal condition of the eyes.  The center of the cornea of both

Female bulldog (microchip 7E10334736, tattoo #138) has an abnormal condition of the foot.  A round dark colored growth

Abnormal conditions of the eyes and feet could cause pain and discomfort to the animals.   
 
Dealers must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries.  The licensee must 
have these dogs evaluated by a veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop an appropriate treatment plan.  The

3.6(a)(2)(x) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The dogs are housed on raised flooring.  The inspectors observed the feet of the following dogs pass through the 
openings in the flooring: 
 
Maltese #3 
Poodle #20 
Maltese #18 
Maltese #8 
Poodle #22 
Maltese #19 
Bernadoodle #47

Maltese #20 
Maltese #21 
Maltese #4 
Maltese #6 
Yorkshire terrier #8 
Yorkshire terrier #9 
 
The inspector measured the width of a front foot of two of the dogs and found the foot to be 3/4 of an inch wide for one

Primary enclosures must have floors that are constructed in a manner that protects the dogs' feet and legs from injury,
